title: Recent Update Falls Short
text:
I've been waiting for Ooma to add the ability to blacklist numbers from the app since I started using it and am very happy that the function is finally here. Where as on the website when you blacklist a number there is a visual cue (a red circle with a line through it) that let's you know that you have successfully added that number to the blacklist. 

Currently, when you go back to look at at number you may have blacklisted the day before, it still says "Add to Blacklist" as if you never took any action on that number. And if you tap that link, it takes you through the process as if you didn't blacklist it. That made me have go to the website just to double check that it the blacklist was actually applied ‚Äî which renders the efficiency and convenience of the new feature moot. It can be something like turning the "Add to Blacklist" red or replacing that with the red circle with the line through it (like on the website) to let you know that you were sucessful in blacklisting a number.

title: International Calling Wizard
text:
Writing reviews is not something that I do often but I feel compelled to spread the news about Ooma, especially for international travelers. 

After moving from the USA to New Zealand nearly a year ago I looked at several options for international calling plans including other Internet-based services. I was skeptical initially about Ooma but two of my friends highly recommended it. I‚Äôm glad that I listened to them. 

Choosing a phone number from the locale in the USA where I have most of my contacts has allowed simple dialing and I have used Ooma exclusively for international calls now for eight months. Since calls are placed using a local USA number it is very easy for people to return calls without any special dialing. There are no international charges or fees, and the quality of the calls are crystalline (at least as clear as when I‚Äôm in the USA using the local phone service there) with no calls being dropped. 

I do all of my calls off the Ooma app on an iPhone which works perfectly using either Wi-Fi or data on my local cell plan. Compared to other proprietary apps this one uses battery storage sparingly, so extended calls for business or to friends doesn‚Äôt flatten the battery. This app has made it convenient to use this service just like another line on my phone; the phone rings with a different chime letting me know it‚Äôs an Ooma call, I touch the screen to accept the call and I‚Äôm speaking to someone on the other side of the world just like they were next door. The value for the cost of the service is tremendous. 

I‚Äôm a very picky, skeptical person and Ooma has provided service well beyond my expectations.

text:
Updated 01/19:   Though still a fan of Ooma (this is my 10th anniversary as an Ooma customer!) I have a couple of main complaints about the company.  The app is slowly getting better, but doesn‚Äôt really match their website yet.  My two issues are that the company doesn‚Äôt seem to listen to people who post issues or recommendations on their Forum site.  I‚Äôve reported several issues and have never received a company response.  And I‚Äôve seen many others equally ignored.

The other issue is that I greatly regret buying their Ooma branded home phones.  The Telo is fine, the Lynx works pretty good, but the three handsets I bought are buggy, poor quality sound and frequent ‚Äòupdates‚Äô shuts down your entire phone system until all phones are updated (1 - 1.5 hours each time).  You have no control when this happens.  And when people call me the system drops the call a few seconds after I answer, making it seem like I am purposely hanging up on people.   Reported this and other things on their Forums, no response ...

Prior review:
Though I have not used this app much since recently downloading it (though I plan to use it more) I can say that over the years I have had this VOIP service I have been very pleased with it.  I do think that Ooma was a little slow in adding features at first, I have been happy with its evolution.  My original Ooma Hub has been in service all these years with only one service failure that I recall.  Though it was the service, not the Hub that experienced the service gap (less than one day of downtime as I recall).  I have now replaced the dependable Hub with a new Telo (and Telo Linx).   No company or service is perfect, but my experience with Ooma has been a positive one and though somewhat skeptical at first whether the startup Ooma company would survive I am glad they have done so.  I also like the integration with my Amazon Echo (and look forward to some feature enhancements with both devices).  Also, I, like many, would like to see an iPad version.  It's been far too long coming.  Having a phone version only is amateurish.

title: Won't stop ringing!
text:
I finally turned on incoming and outgoing calls in the IOS app since I keep an old iPhone on the nightstand as a quick browsing device. I have used it to make a couple of quick calls when I didn't feel like grabbing an Ooma connected handset. It works well for that function. 

I do have an issue with the IOS app continuing to ring long after the directly connected Ooma handset or linked number device (my cellphone) has picked the call. One day, I found the iPhone had been ringing for hours after I completed an incoming Ooma call routed to my cellphone. I also have to rush to my browser iPhone to stop it from ringing if I pick up a call on the Ooma connected handset. From the Ooma forums, I see this has been a problem since at least 2015! I know there have been updates to the IOS app since then and it is still occurring. 

Configuration:
*Ooma tell connected to house main telephone circuit, Ooma Premier plan
*Ooma IOS app v7.2 (255590), ring home phone set, ring app disabled (until the problem is fixed), ring external number set, incoming and outgoing calls enabled

title: In serious need of an update!
Please contact Ooma for any issues
text:
If you have issues with the app, please visit the Help screen, choose Report a Problem, and describe your issue.  That will give Ooma the diagnostic info necessary to investigate and fix it.  If you have a problem with your password or login, please call support at 888-711-6662 in the US and 866-929-6662 in Canada.  

Thanks!
